summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This letter is from Paul and Silas and Timothy. It is to you, the church, in the city of Thessalonica. You belong to God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. May you have His loving-favor and His peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We thank God for you all the time and pray for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While praying to God our Father, we always remember your work of faith and your acts of love and your hope that never gives up in our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, we know God loves you and that He has chosen you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Good News did not come to you by word only, but with power and through the Holy Spirit. You knew it was true. You also knew how we lived among you. It was for your good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You followed our way of life and the life of the Lord. You suffered from others because of listening to us. But you had the joy that came from the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of your good lives, you are showing all the Christians in the countries of Macedonia and Greece how to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord has been spoken by you in the countries of Macedonia and Greece. People everywhere know of your faith in God without our telling them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people themselves tell us how you received us when we came to you. They talk of how you turned to God from worshiping false gods. Now you worship the true and living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tell us how you are waiting for His Son Jesus to come down from heaven. God raised Him from the dead. It is Jesus Who will save us from the anger of God that is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, you know that my visit with you was not wasted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just before we came to you, we had been in the city of Philippi. You know how they worked against us and made us suffer. But God helped us preach the Good News to you without fear, even while many people hated us and made it hard for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You remember what we said to you was true. We had no wrong desire in teaching you. We did not try to fool you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has allowed us to be trusted with the Good News. Because of this, we preach it to please God, not man. God tests and proves our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know we never used smooth-sounding words. God knows we never tried to get money from you by preaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We never looked for thanks from men, not from you or from anyone else. But because we were missionaries of Christ, we could have asked you to do much for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, we were gentle when we came to you. We were like a mother caring for her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We had such a strong desire to help you that we were happy to give you the Good News. Because we loved you so much, we were ready to give you our own lives also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You remember, Christian brothers, we worked night and day for our food and clothes while we preached the Good News to you. We did not want to make it hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know, and so does God, how pure and right and without blame we were among you who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a father helps his children, you know how we wanted to help you and give you comfort. We told you with strong words
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you should live to please God. He is the One Who chose you to come into His holy nation and to share His shining-greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We always thank God that when you heard the Word of God from us, you believed it. You did not receive it as from men, but you received it as the Word of God. That is what it is. It is at work in the lives of you who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, you became just like the churches in the country of Judea. You had to suffer from the men in your country as those churches had to suffer from the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the Jews who killed the Lord Jesus and the early preachers. The Jews made it hard for us and made us leave. They do not please God and are working against all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried to keep us from preaching the Good News to the people who are not Jews. The Jews do not want them saved from the punishment of sin. The lives of the Jews are full of more sin all the time. But now God’s anger has come to them at last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, because we have not been able to be with you, our hearts have been with you. We have wanted very much to see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We wanted to come to you. I, Paul, have tried to come to you more than once but Satan kept us from coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is our hope or joy or crown of happiness? It is you, when you stand before our Lord Jesus Christ when He comes again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are our pride and joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we could wait no longer, we decided it was best to stay in the city of Athens alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sent Timothy to you. He works with us for God, teaching the Good News of Christ. We sent him to give strength and comfort to your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not want anyone to give up because of troubles. You know that we can expect troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when we were with you, we told you that much trouble would come to us. It has come as you can see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, I could wait no longer. I sent Timothy to find out about your faith. I was afraid the devil had tempted you. Then our work with you would be wasted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Timothy has come to us from you. He brought good news about your faith and love. It is good to know that you think well of us and that you would like to see us. We would like to see you also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, word about your faith has made us happy even while we are suffering and are in much trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is life to us to know that your faith in the Lord is strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can we give God enough thanks for you for all the joy you give us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We keep on praying night and day that we may see you again. We want to help your faith to be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May our God and Father Himself and the Lord Jesus Christ take us on our way to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord make you grow in love for each other and for everyone. We have this kind of love for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May our God and Father make your hearts strong and without blame. May your hearts be without sin in God’s sight when our Lord Jesus comes again with all those who belong to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, we ask you, because of the Lord Jesus, to keep on living in a way that will please God. I have already told you how to grow in the Christian life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Jesus gave us the right and the power to tell you what to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God wants you to be holy. You must keep away from sex sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God wants each of you to use his body in the right way by keeping it holy and by respecting it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should not use it to please your own desires like the people who do not know God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man should do wrong to his Christian brother in anything. The Lord will punish a person who does. I have told you this before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not called us to live in sin. He has called us to live a holy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who turns away from this teaching does not turn away from man, but from God. It is God Who has given us His Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not need anyone to write to you about loving your Christian brothers. God has taught you to love each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You love all the Christians in all the country of Macedonia. But we ask you to love them even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do your best to live a quiet life. Learn to do your own work well. We told you about this before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By doing this, you will be respected by those who are not Christians. Then you will not be in need and others will not have to help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, we want you to know for sure about those who have died. You have no reason to have sorrow as those who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We believe that Jesus died and then came to life again. Because we believe this, we know that God will bring to life again all those who belong to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We tell you this as it came from the Lord. Those of us who are alive when the Lord comes again will not go ahead of those who have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord Himself will come down from heaven with a loud call. The head angel will speak with a loud voice. God’s horn will give its sounds. First, those who belong to Christ will come out of their graves to meet the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, those of us who are still living here on earth will be gathered together with them in the clouds. We will meet the Lord in the sky and be with Him forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, comfort each other with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not need anyone to write to tell you when and at what kind of times these things will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know for sure that the day the Lord comes back to earth will be as a robber coming in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they say, “Everything is fine and safe,” then all at once they will be destroyed. It will be like pain that comes on a woman when a child is born. They will not be able to get away from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not in darkness, Christian brothers. That day will not surprise you as a robber would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are children of the light and of the day. We are not of darkness or of night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep awake! Do not sleep like others. Watch and keep your minds awake to what is happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People sleep at night. Those who get drunk do it at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because we are men of the day, let us keep our minds awake. Let us cover our chests with faith and love. Let us cover our heads with the hope of being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God planned to save us from the punishment of sin through our Lord Jesus Christ. He did not plan for us to suffer from His anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died for us so that, dead or alive, we will be with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So comfort each other and make each other strong as you are already doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ask you, Christian brothers, to respect those who work among you. The Lord has placed them over you and they are your teachers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must think much of them and love them because of their work. Live in peace with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ask you, Christian brothers, speak to those who do not want to work. Comfort those who feel they cannot keep going on. Help the weak. Understand and be willing to wait for all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone pay back for the bad he received. But look for ways to do good to each other and to all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be full of joy all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never stop praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In everything give thanks. This is what God wants you to do because of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not try to stop the work of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not laugh at those who speak for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Test everything and do not let good things get away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep away from everything that even looks like sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the God of peace set you apart for Himself. May every part of you be set apart for God. May your spirit and your soul and your body be kept complete. May you be without blame when our Lord Jesus Christ comes again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The One Who called you is faithful and will do what He promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the Christians with a kiss of holy love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you to have this letter read to all the Christians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May you have loving-favor from our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
